arm_group.description: 2 ml 1% Lidocaine in one ring finger, 1 ml 2% Lidocaine in the other ring finger

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of the study is to find a simple method for pain reduction that can be used in
      clinical practice when administering digital nerve block with a single subcutaneous
      injection. It will be investigated whether a smaller volume of lidocaine can decrease pain
      during injection.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Influence of Lidocaine Volume on Discomfort During Administration of Local Anesthetic

detailed_description.textblock:
Healthy volunteers will receive a single subcutaneous injection digital nerve block at the
      base of each ring finger. 2ml 1% lidocaine in one of the fingers, and 1 ml 2% lidocaine in
      the other. After each injection, the subject will be asked to evaluate the pain on a visual
      analog scale (0-100 mm).  Additionally the sensibility will be tested with a
      Semmes-Weinstein monofilament, to evaluate if the different methods achieve desired
      anesthetic effect.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  age 18 - 65

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  regular use of analgesics

          -  known hypersensitivity of local anaesthetic

          -  renal-, heart- or liver disease

          -  known peripheral neuropathy or diabetes mellitus

          -  local infection on injection site

          -  circulation disorders in upper extremities (e.g. Raynaud´s phenomenon)

clinical_study.official_title: The Influence of Lidocaine Volume on Discomfort During Administration of Local Anesthetic

overall_official.affiliation: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

oversight_info.authority: Norway:National Committee for Medical and Health Research Ethics
